page.title: 11Tourism
page.content: TOURISM. {Delabole as a tourist centre. Delabole cannot be described as a typical tourist village with the main road from{Camelford}to{Port {Isaac}forming its mile_long main street. But it is within easy reach of many tourist attractions, so houses providing{bed and breakfast, holiday {cottages}and{chalets}are part of the Delabole summer season. The{garages, {grocers' shops,cafes,pubs}and{take_ {away food shops}benefit from summer visitors,as do the{charity fetes}held on the village playing field.Delabole housewives may find{seasonal work in the shops,cafes and hotels. In the immediate Delabole area, visitors go to the beaches and cliffs of{Tregardock}and{Trebarwith,}but they also go to the beaches along the{Camel {estuary}or inland to{Bodmin Moor.
